thread.title: Oregon State offense goes three-and-out most frequently in Pac-12: Oregon State Beavers rundown
thread.title_full: Oregon State offense goes three-and-out most frequently in Pac-12: Oregon State Beavers rundown | OregonLive.com

author: Danny Moran | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Oregon State offense goes three-and-out most frequently in Pac-12: Oregon State Beavers rundown
text:
It is no surprise that Oregon State 's offense has struggled at points this season.
The Beavers are starting true freshman quarterback Seth Collins while instituting a new spread offense in one of the country's most rigorous conferences. The confluence of challenging factors has contributed to the team's low offensive efficiency , which ranks 107 th out of 128 FBS teams and last in the Pac-12.
One of the ways Oregon State has hurt itself on offense has been through three-and-outs. For three consecutive games, the Beavers' first drive lasted three plays and resulted in a punt that quickly put the defense back on the field.
Based on an evaluation by The Oregonian/OregonLive, Oregon State (2-4) has gone three-and-out more often and with more frequency than any other Pac-12 team.
The Beavers' offense has done so on 23 of 77 drives in six games this season, a conference-high 29.87 percent of drives. That is nearly four times per game. Colorado (3-4) ranks second worst in the Pac-12 with 23 three-and-out occurrences in 98 drives (23.47 percent).
Oregon State and Colorado play this Saturday at 7:30 p.m.
For the purposes of the analysis, three-and-outs did not count when the drive concluded with a field goal.
